intro: Mesadenia lanceolata var. virescens, commonly known as the green-stemmed mesadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
